result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott R. Ciotti was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
**  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges. Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay DNA surcharge (unless previously paid).
** Pay restitution plus surcharges.    May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
**  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered. Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharges.    May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

From Drug Abuse Correctional Center.   enclosed is an amendment to Judgment of Convcition and order.
All counts consecutive to Cts 1,4 & 7
All counts 9, 11,14,1,6,18, 20, 23, 26 & 28 conseuctive to Cts 1 4 & 7.
From DOC  asking for clarification on  Ct 11,14, 16, 18, 20, 23, 26, & 28  to be consecutive to Cts 1, 4 & 7.
In the amount of:  $1139.00 (date changed to match file stamp 12/02/2020 jh)
For Restitution Order - filed by ADA R Delgado.
from Chris Schoen/PSG. Inc.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge
Extended Supervision Conditions-ordered by the court

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney C Glinski.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court imposes a total sentence of 5 years WSP, concurrent on cts 1, 4 & 7; 3 years initial confinement w/credit for 296 days served; 2 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is eligible for SAP; deft is not eligible for CIP; on cts 9, 11, 14, 16, 18, 20, 23, 26 & 28 the court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 4 years w/conditions, concurrent on each ct and consecutive to cts 1, 4 & 7; restitution ordered in the amount of $1,139 (by stipulation of deft); deft to pay DNA surcharge on each count.
With Atty Glinski the SEH of 6/2/16 at 9am is rescheduled, due to a trial proceeding in Br 6 on this date; reset to 6/20/16 at 3:30pm.  Atty Glinski to attempt to notify client of change.
With Atty Glinski and by agreement of ADA Phan the SEH of 5/9/16 at 1:30pm is rescheduled, to allow time for the deft to be evaluated for the Vivitrol program; reset to 6/2/16 at 9am.

With ADA Phan and Atty Glinski the SEH of 4/21/16 at 3:30pm is rescheduled, to a date when Judge Wagner is here as Judge Kluka believes she has a conflict, also Atty Glinski would like to obtain some additional documentation I hope to submit for consideration at sentencing; reset to 5/9/16 at 1:30pm.
From Atty C Glinski with accompanying letters on deft's behalf for sentencing date of 4/21/16 at 3:30pm.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney C Glinski.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, cts 2, 3, 5, 6, 8, 10, 12, 13, 15, 17, 19, 21, 22, 24, 25, 27, 29 & 30 are dismissed and read in.  Deft pleads guilty to cts 1, 4, 7, 9, 11, 14, 16, 18, 20, 23, 26 & 28.  Court  finds deft guilty of cts 1, 4, 7, 9, 11, 14, 16, 18, 20, 23, 26 & 28.  PSI ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  SEH 4/21/16 at 3:30pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney C Glinski.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Glinski wants to speak with ADA Phan further.  PLEAH continued to 3/16/16 at 1:15pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Attorney C Glinski appeared on behalf of deft.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft in custody but not brought over.  Atty Glinski reported that the deft is in the living free program now and is being considered for the drug court.  PLEAH set for 3/8/16 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.
With Atty Glinski, and by agreement of ADA Phan the STC of 11/25/15 at 1:15pm is rescheduled, as they are attempting to get the deft into the drug court; reset to 1/8/16 at 8:45am.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Continued

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney C Glinski.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Glinski states he has reviewed discovery; believes case can be resolved.  DA PTC 11/20/15 at 1:30pm and STC 11/25/15 at 1:15pm.  Atty Glinski requests that bond be adjusted down $1.  Court amends cash bond to $99,999.00 w/same conditions previously set.

Court requests the jail allow defendant attend programming; Court to call the jail to make the request. Defendant Scott R. Ciotti appeared with Attorney Andrea K Rufo.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found. Bound over to Br 6.  Information filed, reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 08:15 am.
